definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
heddle (device to form warp in weaving textiles)/Taiwan pr. [zong4]
to sum up/to put together/Taiwan pr. [zong4]
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: The development of Balzac's literary ideology is a complicated course.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔扎克文艺思想的发展是一个错综复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Because of the complexity of its pathogenesis, the exact causes of GCA are still not clear.
sentences.chinese: GCA的发病机制错综复杂，目前尚未完全明确。

sentences.english: The categories of the lubricated duplicators are intricate.
sentences.chinese: 那些润滑过的复印机的种类错综复杂。
健康和休息是错综复杂的。

sentences.english: The Taj Mahal itself forms the centerpiece of a 42-acre complex.
sentences.chinese: 泰姬陵的中心墓室错综复杂，占地42英亩。

sentences.english: The picture of hukou reform across China remains mixed.
sentences.chinese: 中国各地的户籍改革状况仍然错综复杂。

sentences.english: Complex fractures, though—those that involve bones shattered into fragments—are more challenging.
sentences.chinese: 可使若骨折的骨片错综复杂则很难矫正。

sentences.english: Matters are very complex. It's very difficult to find a single solution to all problems.
sentences.chinese: 事情错综复杂，很难找到一个一了百了的解决办法。

sentences.english: If it is industrious enough, an intricate web of knowledge spins out from it.
sentences.chinese: 如果它十分勤奋，它就能织出一张错综复杂的知识网。

sentences.english: because of the financial intricacies which I won't get into.
sentences.chinese: 因为我不懂得财政的错综复杂。

sentences.english: There had been complicated conflicts between "Jingshu" and literature in the Imperial Examinations from Tang Dynasty to Yuan Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 从唐代至元代科场中存在错综复杂的经术与文学之争。

sentences.english: The moves in chess are not only manifold, but involute.
sentences.chinese: 下棋的走法不但多种多样，而且错综复杂。

sentences.english: He wandered helplessly through the labyrinthine by ways of modern literature.
sentences.chinese: 他在错综复杂的现代文学冷僻部份无助地徘徊着。

sentences.english: His tactics were to entangle the opposition in a web of parliamentary procedure.
sentences.chinese: 他的策略是使反对派陷入错综复杂的议会程序之中。

sentences.english: This opening section will analyse the intricacies of the different approaches.
sentences.chinese: 本章一开始将分析这些错综复杂的不同流派。

sentences.english: There is a complex network of roads connecting Glasgow and Edinburgh.
sentences.chinese: 格拉斯哥与爱丁堡之间有个错综复杂的道路网。

definition: twisted roots and intertwined joints (idiom); complicated and very tricky/knotty and deeply-rooted difficulties
lit. pull one hair and the whole body moves/fig. a slight change will affect everything else/the butterfly effect
pinyin: qian1 yi1 fa4 er2 dong4 quan2 shen1

definition: closely linked with one another/interlocked/to interrelate
to be linked together/to be involved with/to collude/interconnection/involvement/collusion
lit. to spin silk from cocoons/fig. to make a painstaking investigation (idiom)
